decision_conditions: Approved PlansThe development herby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the approved plans including plans that may have been revised or may have been amended, as set out in the attached schedule which forms part of this notice.Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

WindNotwithstanding and in addition to the wind report assessment prepared by Windtech, (dated: June 17 2022) no superstructure works shall be carried out unless and until further wind tunnel testing has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority  to identify if additional mitigation measures are required to be affixed to the building and/or accommodated within the public realm and to demonstrate that the mitigation measures proposed constitute appropriate mitigation. Details of the mitigation measures shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and installed in accordance with the approved details prior to first occupation.  Reason: To ensure the mitigation measures do not prejudice the design of the development and that the public realm is fit for purpose in accordance with policies D3, D4 and D9 of the New London Plan (2021).

Architectural Detail"Notwithstanding and in addition to the architectural plans submitted, no superstructure works shall be carried out unless and until  details of the proposed parapets, coping and cornicing for Block A and details of all canopies attached to the building (to a minimum scale of 1:20) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall be completed in accordance with the approved details. Reason: To ensure a satisfactory external appearance in accordance with policies D3 and D4 of the New London Plan (2021), CP30 of the Enfield Core Strategy (2010) and DMD37 of the Enfield Development Management Policy (2014)."

Lighting Prior to occupation a lighting strategy detailing the lighting around the permitter of the building shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The strategy shall include details of the location, specification, and direction of any external artificial lighting within 15 metres of Pymmes Brook ensuring that such lighting is maintained at background levels (considered by the Environment Agency to be a Lux level of 0-2). The approved lighting shall be provided prior to the occupation of any residential unit. Reason: In order to ensure a safe environment for future occupants and visitors to the site and to reduce the risk of crime.

Secure by Design Prior to occupation, the development shall achieve a Certificate of Compliance to the relevant Secure by Design Guide(s) or alternatively achieve Crime Prevention Standards submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority in conjunction with the Metropolitan Police. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and thereafter shall be fully retained and maintained as such for the lifetime of the development.Reason: In the interest of creating safer, secure, sustainable communities

Off site playspace provision Prior to the occupation of any residential unit within this plot, a playspace strategy demonstrating a minimum provision of 718m2 of playspace for ages 5 - 11 within Brooks Park, including timing of delivery of the play space, shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval in writing. Unless having been already approved through conditions of the outline consent (19/02718/RE3), the strategy shall include details of the design and type of play equipment to be installed within the identified playspace.  The approved strategy shall be implemented prior to the occupation of no more than 100 residential dwellings within this plot.  Reason: In the interests of the amenity of residents and to ensure that sufficient, suitable and high quality playspace is provided for this phase of development in accordance with policies D5, D6 and D8 of the New London Plan (2021).
